channel.title: December 7th, 2011 V2
channel.description:
http://newsvoice.se/2011/12/02/us-senate-declares-the-entire-usa-to-be-a-battleground/
Bill of Rights in America? Nah, cya hicks.

item.title: December 7th, 2011 V2

house is republican senate is still democratic but they lost a few seats

item.title: December 7th, 2011 V2
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:51, topic:423877”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=526530.msg3837166#msg3837166 date=1322968674]

The only reason this has any progress is because the Senate is primarily republican. The House of Representatives won’t let this pass without MASSIVE reform, and even if it DOES make it to the president, he’ll just veto it. I see no threat.

I’m putting my faith on the supreme court

the obama administration is so corrupted its not even funny
[/quote]

No no no, see…

Senate - Republican
HOR - Led Democratic
Pres - Democratic

Even if it DOES get to Obama, because it was started in the Senate he’ll turn it down.[/quote]The Senate is more than 50% Democratic too.

Read full topic

item.title: December 7th, 2011 V2
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:52, topic:423877”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=526530.msg3837188#msg3837188 date=1322969085]

The only reason this has any progress is because the Senate is primarily republican. The House of Representatives won’t let this pass without MASSIVE reform, and even if it DOES make it to the president, he’ll just veto it. I see no threat.

I’m putting my faith on the supreme court

the obama administration is so corrupted its not even funny

No no no, see…

Senate - Republican
HOR - Led Democratic
Pres - Democratic
Even if it DOES get to Obama, because it was started in the Senate he’ll turn it down.
[/quote]
Congress can override a veto, and when they’re at a 9% approval rating I don’t think they’re going to try and do the right thing.[/quote]

Oh yea… that is a problem. Again, let’s hope the house makes HUGE edits.

Read full topic

item.title: December 7th, 2011 V2
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:32, topic:423877”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=526530.msg3836893#msg3836893 date=1322960446]

Read this earlier today. Once this becomes law, you have no rights whatsoever in America – no due process, no First Amendment speech rights, no right to remain silent, nothing. The US military would have the power to arrest, detain, interrogate and even assassinate U.S. citizens with impunity.
[/quote]The only real difference is that they could do this legally. Innocent people are already being arrested for no reason whatsoever.

I really wonder what you think America goes on in the US, cops don’t just go around arresting people for no reason.[/quote]Cops, no. CIA, yes.

Read full topic

item.title: December 7th, 2011 V2
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:44, topic:423877"][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=526530.msg3837031#msg3837031 date=1322963697]

Fake.

No.

Yes.

You’re painfully uninformed.

Complete opposite my good sir.

http://www.govtrack.us/congress/amendment.xpd?session=112&amdt=s1274

Believe what you want.
[/quote]That’s not the same bill… the news says ‘93-7’ won but your site says ‘41-59’ declined

the bill he linked to was the one proposed to provide certain exemptions for U.S. citizens iirc.[/quote]Yea that’s what it looks like, except it’s not a bill. It’s an amendment to the real bill, and it was declined. Lol.

Read full topic

item.description:

it is real…

GovTrack.us

National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012 (2011 - S. 1867)

An original bill to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2012 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for...
